heading: geezer squeezer
subheading: the 82-year-old actor who made a career out of warning supermarket shoppers "please don't squeeze the charmin" is making a comeback as mr. whipple. in 1978, television viewers ranked bathroom-tissue pitchman dick wilson as the third best-known american, behind former president nixon and the reverend billy graham. and why not? mr. whipple appeared for over 20 years in more than 500 commercials.
author: wired staff
text: the 82-year-old actor who made a career out of warning supermarket shoppers "please don't squeeze the charmin" is making a comeback as mr. whipple. in 1978, television viewers ranked bathroom-tissue pitchman dick wilson as the third best-known american, behind former president nixon and the reverend billy graham. and why not? mr. whipple appeared for over 20 years in more than 500 commercials.
